Package Phase2

Class Tetris

  • java.lang.Object
    • Phase2.Tetris
  • public class Tetris
extends java.lang.Object
    The Tetris class represents the game of Tetris. It contains methods for placing and removing pieces, clearing rows, and moving and rotating pieces. It also has constants for the size of the game grid and the maximum and minimum velocities of the falling pieces. The class uses a MainScreen object to display the game to the user.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Tetris()
      Constructs a new Tetris game instance with a randomly selected piece, initializes the game field, and creates a new MainScreen object if one does not already exist.

      • initialID

        public java.lang.String initialID
        This method selects a random piece from the PIECES array and sets the current piece, ID, and position accordingly. If the randomly selected piece is one of the pieces that can be flipped, there is a 50% chance that the piece will be flipped.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tetris

        public Tetris()
        Constructs a new Tetris game instance with a randomly selected piece, initializes the game field, and creates a new MainScreen object if one does not already exist.

    • Method Detail

      • runTetris

        public void runTetris()
        Sets the state of the screen to the current field and starts the game loop.

      • restartTetris

        public void restartTetris()
        Resets the game state and starts a new game of Tetris. Sets the game over flag to false, score to 0, piece velocity to initial velocity, initializes the game field, gets the next random piece, sets the screen state to the field, and starts the game loop.

      • startGameLoop

        public void startGameLoop()
        Starts the game loop which updates the game state and screen at a fixed interval. Uses two timers, one for the game loop and another for updating the piece velocity.

      • canPlace

        public static boolean canPlace​(int[][] field,
                               int[][] piece,
                               int row,
                               int col)
        Determines if a given piece can be placed on the field at the specified row and column.
        Parameters:
        field - the field to place the piece on
        piece - the piece to place on the field
        row - the row to place the piece at
        col - the column to place the piece at
        Returns:
        true if the piece can be placed at the specified location, false otherwise

      • removePiece

        public void removePiece​(int[][] field,
                        int[][] piece,
                        int row,
                        int col)
        Removes a piece from the field at the specified row and column.
        Parameters:
        field - the field to remove the piece from
        piece - the piece to remove
        row - the row to remove the piece from
        col - the column to remove the piece from

      • addPiece

        public void addPiece​(int[][] piece,
                     int pentID,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        Adds a given piece to the game field at the specified row and column.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to be added to the field
        pentID - the ID of the piece
        row - the row where the piece will be added
        col - the column where the piece will be added

      • addPiece

        public void addPiece​(int[][] board,
                     int[][] piece,
                     int pentID,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        OVERLOAD Adds a piece to the board at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        board - the game board represented as a 2D array
        piece - the piece to be added represented as a 2D array
        pentID - the ID of the piece
        row - the row index where the piece should be added
        col - the column index where the piece should be added

      • moveDown

        public boolean moveDown()
        Moves the current piece down by one row if possible, updates the game field and the MainScreen. If the piece cannot be moved down, it is added to the game field and the method returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the piece was successfully moved down, false otherwise.

      • dropPiece

        public void dropPiece()
        Drops the current piece down as far as it can go and updates the game field.

      • rotateRight

        public void rotateRight()
        Rotates the current piece 90 degrees clockwise and updates the game field. If the rotated piece can be placed in the current position, it becomes the new current piece. Otherwise, the original piece remains in place.

      • flipPiece

        public int[][] flipPiece()
        Flips the current piece horizontally.
        Returns:
        the flipped piece as a 2D integer array.

      • rotateLeft

        public void rotateLeft()
        Rotates the current piece to the left. Removes the current piece from the field, rotates it, and checks if it can be placed in the new position. If it can be placed, updates the current piece with the rotated piece and adds it to the field. Finally, updates the MainScreen with the new state of the field.

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Moves the current piece one cell to the left on the game field, if possible. If the piece cannot be moved, it remains in its current position. Updates the MainScreen with the new state of the game field.

      • moveLeftToTheBorder

        public void moveLeftToTheBorder()
        Moves the current piece to the left border of the field. Removes the current piece from its current position, then continuously moves it to the left until it reaches the left border or encounters an obstacle. Finally, adds the current piece to the leftmost position and updates the MainScreen.

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Moves the current piece one cell to the right on the game field, if possible. If the piece cannot be moved, it remains in its current position. Updates the MainScreen with the new state of the game field.

      • accelerateMovingDown

        public void accelerateMovingDown()
        Sets the accelerateDown flag to true and decreases the pieceVelocity by 100 if it is greater than the minimum velocity. Calls the updateSpeed method of the MainScreen class to update the speed of the game.

      • decelerateMovingDown

        public void decelerateMovingDown()
        Decelerates the falling speed of the tetromino piece. Sets accelerateDown to false and increases the pieceVelocity by 100 if it is less than MAXIMUM_VELOCITY. Updates the speed on the MainScreen.

      • initializeField

        public void initializeField()
        Initializes the field by creating a new 2D integer array with the dimensions of HORIZONTAL_GRID_SIZE and VERTICAL_GRID_SIZE. Then, it sets all the values of the array to -1. Finally, it rotates the matrix and sets it as the actual matrix.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args -

      • getUpdatedPieceVelocity

        public int getUpdatedPieceVelocity()

      • getWorkingField

        public int[][] getWorkingField()

      • getSimulatedDropField

        public int[][] getSimulatedDropField​(int[][] field)
        Returns a simulated drop field by creating a copy of the given field and simulating the drop of the current piece. The current piece is removed from the copied field, and then the lowest possible position for the piece to drop is determined. The piece is then added to the copied field at the lowest position, and the resulting field is returned.
        Parameters:
        field - The original field.
        Returns:
        The simulated drop field.

      • getLowestY

        public int getLowestY()
        Returns the lowest Y-coordinate of the current piece on the Tetris field. The lowest Y-coordinate represents the bottommost row occupied by the current piece.
        Returns:
        The lowest Y-coordinate of the current piece.

      • checkGameOver

        public boolean checkGameOver()
        Checks if the game is over by determining if the current piece can be placed on the field.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise.

      • characterToID

        public static int characterToID​(char character)
        Get as input the character representation of a pentomino and translate it into its corresponding numerical value (ID).
        Parameters:
        character - a character representing a pentomino
        Returns:
        the corresponding ID (numerical value)

      • shufflePieces

        public static char[] shufflePieces​(char[] pieces)
        This method shuffles the order of the Tetris pieces.
        Parameters:
        pieces - An array of characters representing the Tetris pieces to be shuffled.
        Returns:
        A new array of characters representing the shuffled Tetris pieces.
